page.title: 14The Fordingbridge Show.
page.content: {The Fordingbridge Show}first came into being in 1920. It was not held during World War II. It was originally part of the{Fordingbridge Flower and {Poultry Club Show.}When it became larger, it became the {Horse Show. In the late nineteen fifties, cattle were included and it became known as the Fordingbridge Show. Originally it was held in the Recreation Ground. After several venues it has now settled at Godshill. Average attendance is 7-8000 and the show extends over an area of 40 acres. Among the attractions are: traction engines, donkeys, packs of hounds, shire-horses, driving marathon (ponies and traps), gundog trials, mounted police, motor-bikes, dog-show, gymnastics, horse-jumping, clay pigeon shooting, falconry, Naval displays, floral tent, crafts and Tug-of-war.
